review: Its amazing what such a small stick can do. I held off on the Google Chrome device and now I'm glad I did. We use our Fire TV Stick on a nightly basis now, and it works great. We cut cable almost 2 years ago and have yet to find a device that really nails a lot of what we're missing. ESPN, Plex, Netfilx and Amazon Prime selection has just about everything we need. I see that TNT is becoming more stream friendly, so once they release an Android/FireTV app, we'll have everything replaced... without the $100 cable bill.From an operation standpoint, it works great. We use our Logitech Hub Remote 99% of the time, but the iPhone app works solid, and so does the remote. We probably unplug/reboot the stick once every two weeks as it seems like some apps become unresponsive, but thats understandable with technology. Sometimes you just need a reboot.

review: I bought this specifically for use on the road. I stay 175+ nights a year in a hotel and trust me when I say, I needed the entertainment. The problem is, most hotels require you to visit an authentication screen via browser.....this is true with the Fire Stick; it has no browser capability. However, I invested in a HOOTOO travel router which allows you to visit a browser via your phone which in turn allows you to accept the terms and conditions page. I simply log on to the HOOTOO via my Fire Stick. Works like a charm!
